abstract: The fate of the Fed’s strategy could depend on foreign confidence in the dollar and willingness to keep financing the United States’ huge external debt.
snippet: The fate of the Fed’s strategy could depend on foreign confidence in the dollar and willingness to keep financing the United States’ huge external debt.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Having already slashed short-term interest rates by almost half since August, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, Ben S. Bernanke, signaled on Wednesday that more rate cuts  which is to say more cheap money  may lie ahead.

headline.main: Fed Chief Signals He’s Open to More Rate Cuts
